players.name: Alice
memory: You're Alice, the mafioso.
Night 1 begins.
You killed Charlie.
Charlie was found dead.
Day 1 begins.
Diana: "Charlie was a villager, so we need to be careful with our choices. Alice and Bob, we need to hear your thoughts on who might be suspicious."
Bob: "Everyone, I investigated Alice last night and found out she is the mafioso. We need to vote to arrest her today to protect the town."

You: "Bob is lying. If he were the real detective, he’d wait to see reactions or ask for claims; insta-claiming and tunneling me is classic fake-claim mafia. Diana, think: why would I kill Charlie if I were mafia?"

Diana: "Bob, if you are indeed the detective, why did you choose to reveal your investigation so quickly? Alice, your argument about Charlie’s death is intriguing. Both of you, can you provide more insights?"

Bob: "Given the limited number of players, I felt it was critical to reveal my findings immediately to prevent Alice from manipulating the vote. Diana, please trust my investigation result and vote to arrest Alice."

You: "Bob’s insta-claim is convenient after a villager flipped; real detectives fear getting night-killed and draw out info. Diana, ask: why would mafia kill Charlie if Bob had me “confirmed”? It frames me. I think Bob is the liar."
